resources.string: The goal is to guess as many book titles as you can from the book plot. Press Go! to start

A Tale of Two Cities, Charles Dickens= Fellowship of the ring, J.R.R. Tolkien= The two towers, J.R.R. Tolkien= The return of the king, J.R.R. Tolkien= The Little Prince, Antoine de Saint-Exupéry= The Hobbit, J.R.R. Tolkien= The Dream of the Red Chamber, Cao Xueqin= And Then There Were None, Agatha Christie= The Lion the Witch and the Wardrobe, C.S. Lewis= She, H. Rider Haggard= The Da Vinci Code, Dan Brown= Think and Grow Rich, Napoleon Hill= The Catcher in the Rye, J.D. Salinger= The Alchemist, Paulo Coelho= Steps to Christ, Ellen G. White= Lolita, Vladimir Nabokov= Heidi, Johanna Spyri= Baby and Child Care, Benjamin Spock= Anne of Green Gables, L.M. Montgomery= Black Beauty, Anna Sewell= The Name of the Rose, Umberto Eco= The Eagle Has Landed, Jack Higgins= Watership Down, Richard Adams= The Hite Report, Shere Hite= Charlotte\’s Web, E.B. White= The Ginger Man, J.P. Donleavy= The Tale of Peter Rabbit, Beatrix Potter= Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows, J.K. Rowling= Harry potter and the goblet of fire, J.K. Rowling= Jonathan Livingston Seagull, Richard Bach= A Message to Garcia, Elbert Hubbard= Sophie\'s World, Jostein Gaarder= Angels and Demons, Dan Brown= War and Peace, Leo Tolstoy= Pinocchio, Carlo Collodi= You Can Heal Your Life, Louise L. Hay= Kane and Abel, Jeffrey Archer= The Diary of a Young Girl, Anne Frank= In His Steps, Charles M. Sheldon= To Kill a Mockingbird, Harper Lee= Valley of the Dolls, Jacqueline Susann= Gone with the Wind, Margaret Mitchell= One Hundred Years of Solitude, Gabriel García Márquez= The Thorn Birds, Colleen McCullough= The Revolt of Mamie Stover, William Bradford Huie= The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo, Stieg Larsson= The Very Hungry Caterpillar, Eric Carle= The Late Great Planet Earth, Hal Lindsey= Who Moved My Cheese, Spencer Johnson= The Wind in the Willows, Kenneth Grahame= 1984, George Orwell= The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People: Powerful Lessons in Personal Change, Stephen R. Covey= The Celestine Prophecy, James Redfield= The Hunger Games, Suzanne Collins= The Godfather, Mario Puzo= Love Story, Erich Segal= Wolf Totem, Jiang Rong= Love You Forever, Robert Munsch= The Women\'s Room, Marilyn French= What to Expect When You\'re Expecting, Heidi Murkoff= The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn, Mark Twain= The Secret Diary of Adrian Mole Aged 13 3/4, Sue Townsend= Where the Wild Things Are, Maurice Sendak= Fear of Flying, Erica Jong= The Shack, William Paul Young= Goodnight Moon, Margaret Wise Brown= The Neverending Story, Michael Ende= Guess How Much I Love You, Sam McBratney= Shōgun, James Clavell= The Poky Little Puppy, Janette Sebring Lowrey= The Pillars of the Earth, Ken Follett= How to Win Friends and Influence People, Dale Carnegie= Perfume: The Story of a Murderer, Patrick Süskind= The Grapes of Wrath, John Steinbeck= The Horse Whisperer, Nicholas Evans= The Shadow of the Wind, Carlos Ruiz Zafon= The Hitchhiker\'s Guide to the Galaxy, Douglas Adams= Tuesdays with Morrie, Mitch Albom= God\'s Little Acre, Erskine Caldwell= Follow Your Heart, Susanna Tamaro= The Outsiders, S.E. Hinton= Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, Roald Dahl= Norwegian Wood, Haruki Murakami= Peyton Place, Grace Metalious= Dune, Frank Herbert= The Plague, Albert Camus= No Longer Human, Osamu Dazai= The Naked Ape: A Zoologist\'s Study of the Human Animal, Desmond Morris= The Bridges of Madison County, Robert James Waller= Man\'s Search for Meaning, Viktor E. Frankl= The Divine Comedy, Dante Alighieri= Things Fall Apart, Chinua Achebe= The Exorcist, William Peter Blatty= The Gruffalo, Julia Donaldson= Catch-22, Joseph Heller= Eye of the Needle, Ken Follett
